name: Wei Niu 0002
content: Wei Niu @ UGASearchWei NiuAssistant Professor,wniu (AT) uga (DOT) edu,University of Georgia423 Boyd Research and Education CenterSeveral RA positions available for highly motivated Ph.D. candidates. Check details.Wei Niu is an assistant professor in the School of Computing at the University of Georgia. He obtained his Ph.D. degree from the Department of Computer Science at William & Mary, under the supervision of Dr. Bin Ren. Prior to that, he earned a B.S. Degree in Software Engineering from Beihang University in 2016 and worked as a mobile-platform software developer at Bytedance Ltd. from 2016 to 2018. His research interests include:Real-time machine learning systemsAGI on embedded devicesCompiler optimization and parallel computingHis work has been published in some high-impact conferences (PLDI, ASPLOS, MICRO, ICS, ICCV, CVPR, AAAI, NIPS, ECCV, DAC, ASP-DAC, GLSVLSI) and journals (TPAMI, TACO, CACM).Realtime AI Application on Mobile DevicesWei Niu also designed several creative real-time AI-applications on mobile devices based on his research, here are some examples:Network style transferYOLO-V3/YOLO-V4 object detectionSuper resolutionBlack-white image/video coloring3D object detection (based on R2+1D, C3D, S3D models)More video information can be found on our Youtube channel or Bilibili Channel.Selected Publications* means equal contributionSmartMem: Layout Transformation Elimination and Adaptation for Efficient DNN Execution on MobileWei Niu, Md Musfiqur Rahman Sanim, Zhihao Shu, Jiexiong Guan, Xipeng Shen, Miao Yin, Gagan Agrawal, Bin RenInternational Conference on Architectural Support for Programming Languages and Operating Systems ASPLOS'24 SoD²: Statically Optimizing Dynamic Deep Neural Network ExecutionWei Niu, Gagan Agrawal, Bin RenInternational Conference on Architectural Support for Programming Languages and Operating Systems ASPLOS'24 GCD²: A Globally Optimizing Compiler for Mapping DNNs to Mobile DSPsWei Niu, Jiexiong Guan, Xipeng Shen, Yanzhi Wang, Gagan Agrawal, Bin RenThe 55th IEEE/ACM International Symposium on Microarchitecture MICRO'22 MEST: Accurate and Fast Memory-Economic Sparse Training Framework on the EdgeYuan, G., Ma, X., Niu, W., Li, Z., Kong, Z., Liu, N., Gong, Y., Zhan, Z., He, C., Jin, Q., Wang, S., Qin, M., Ren, B., Wang, Y., Liu, S., Lin, X.The 35th Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems NeurIPS'21 Achieving on-Mobile Real-Time Super-Resolution with Neural Architecture and Pruning SearchZ.
